revisions.rev:
{{orphan|date=December 2010}} {{autobiography|date=January 2011}} '''Amanda "Amy" Clare Lockwood''' (born April 29, 1987) is a Canadian [[actor]], [[comedian]], [[singer-songwriter]]. In 2004 she created, produced and hosted the weekly sketch-comedy series ''The Amy Lockwood Project'' on [[Rogers Television]]. She is most recently known for her work in the film [[Listen to Your Heart (film)|Listen To Your Heart]]. She regularly performs original songs at comedy clubs in [[New York City]].
== Life and career == Amy Lockwood was born in [[Ottawa, Ontario, Canada]].
Lockwood attended [[Nepean High School (Ottawa)|Nepean High School]] in [[Ottawa]] where she was heavily involved in theatre and competed on their [[Improvisational theatre|improv]] team at the [[Canadian Improv Games]] in 2004 and 2005.<ref>http://www.rogerstv.com/page.aspx?rid=4&lid=12&sid=1623</ref><ref>http://www.listentoyourheartfilm.com/cast.php?page=amy</ref> After high school, Lockwood studied musical theater at the University of Southern Maine in Gorham, ME.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lockwood's Professional Resume|url=http://www.talentjug.com/profile/amyclarelockwood/resume/download|work=TalentJug - Resume|accessdate=16 September 2011}}</ref>
Lockwood moved to [[New York City]] in 2006 as one of the youngest accepted students to [[Circle in the Square Theater School]].<ref>http://www.listentoyourheartfilm.com/cast.php?page=amy</ref>
=== Television === Lockwood began making short films with her family's video camera as a teen. In 2004, a junior in high school, she submitted a three-episode outline of a [[sketch-comedy]] series "made for youth, ''by'' youth" to [[Rogers Television]], which became ''[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1819274/ The Amy Lockwood Project]''<ref>http://www.rogerstv.com/page.aspx?rid=4&lid=12&sid=1623</ref>
The show aired weekly on [[Rogers Television]] in the 2004-2005 season.<ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1819274/</ref> Her work on the show earned her the '''Donna Murdie Award''' to recognize an "outstanding woman in the media" at the 2005 ''Spirit of the Capital Youth Awards''.<ref>http://www.listentoyourheartfilm.com/cast.php?page=amy</ref><ref>http://www.rockchicksrock.com/2010/07/tonights-spotlight-amy-lockwood/</ref>
=== Film === After graduating from [[Circle in the Square Theater School]], Amy appeared in the film ''[[Listen to Your Heart (film)|Listen To Your Heart]]'' as Nicole, who aids the lead character in a plot to outsmart her mother ([[Cybill Shepherd]]) and reunite the two lovers.<ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1274296/</ref>
Amy also recently appeared in the film "I Hate Toronto: A Love Story", in which she plays the leading lady and love interest to a suicidal young man who she aids in finding a reason to live. <ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1816549/</ref>
=== Comedy/Songwriting === Lockwood regularly performs at [[Broadway Comedy Club]], [[Eastville Comedy Club]], and [[New York Comedy Club]], among others. In July 2010, her songs were featured on [[CBS Radio]]'s ''Rock Chicks Live!'' podcast.<ref>http://www.rockchicksrock.com/2010/07/tonights-spotlight-amy-lockwood/</ref>
In August, 2010, Lockwood was hired to write a song for [http://www.discoveryhillproductions.com Discovery Hill Productions] [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1776326/ The Global Village Project], a documentary about [http://globalvillage.typepad.com/ The Global Village School] for refugee women in Atlanta, GA.<ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1776326/</ref> She spent a week at the school teaching the students her original piece ''Song For Another''. The documentary is set for release in February, 2011 and will be narrated by actor [[Matthew Lillard]].<ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1776326/</ref><ref>http://www.discoveryhillproductions.com</ref>
